ground_truth: Students bustle into the classroom as the teacher, Mr. Tinker, tries to maintain order. Juno heads toward her desk, sets down her bag, looks up, and meets eyes with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. Her girl lab partner stalks off dramatically. Juno examines a large ad in the newspaper depicting a distraught teen girl clutching her head. She smacks the phone a couple of times. A health teacher in slow motion puts a condom on a banana. We see Paulie's face at the moment of his deflowering; he's comically wide-eyed with shock. Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell sit at a typical kitchen table, eating dinner. Mac shovels food while chatting about his day. A pile of neglected cacti festers in a corner of Juno's room. Bren is cutting up Liberty Bell's food diligently, with her brilliant nails holding the silverware. Bren stitches a needlepoint pillow of a dog. Bren's nail salon is in full glory as she chats up a customer and applies a fresh coat while speaking in her strong city accent. Liberty Bell blithely pours bacon bits onto her dinner. Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic and recognizes the protester as a classmate. She continues toward the clinic entrance, considers the situation, and pushes open the clinic door. The receptionist sits behind bulletproof glass. Juno flashes jazz hands, and the receptionist raises an eyebrow and arranges paperwork on a clipboard, handing it with a pen and holding up a fistful of purple condoms from a clinic jar. The semi-crowded waiting room is occupied mostly by pregnant women, teens, and ill-behaved children. The receptionist points to the paper, motions for Juno to look, and Juno scans an ad silently. The ad contains a photo of an attractive couple with ambiguous smiles. We see Paulie’s bedroom window with childish curtains and the light on inside. Bleeker lies on his car-bed in his track uniform, listening to the same LP from when he and Juno were intimate, and stares at Juno's yearbook photo, which has a sloppy handwritten message from her. Bren and Mac are predictably speechless when Leah presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings. Bren looks alarmed as Juno hastily attempts to legitimize the situation. Music plays, and we see sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s hands preparing her house for Juno's arrival, sprucing a vase of flowers.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Pupils rush into the classroom as the instructor, Mr. Tinker, attempts to uphold order. Juno proceeds toward her desk, places down her bag, glances up, and locks eyes with her longtime laboratory partner, Bleeker. Her female lab partner strides off theatrically. Juno inspects a large advertisement in the newspaper portraying a distressed teenage girl gripping her head. She taps the phone a couple of times. A health instructor in slow motion places a condom on a banana. We observe Paulie's face at the moment of his deflowering; he's humorously wide-eyed with astonishment. Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell are seated at a typical kitchen table, having dinner. Mac scoops food while conversing about his day. A heap of neglected cacti festers in a corner of Juno's room. Bren is slicing up Liberty Bell's food diligently, with her bright nails holding the cutlery. Bren embroiders a needlepoint cushion of a canine. Bren's nail salon is in full splendor as she converses with a customer and applies a fresh layer while speaking in her thick city accent. Liberty Bell cheerfully sprinkles bacon bits onto her meal. Juno trudges toward the main entrance of the clinic and identifies the demonstrator as a schoolmate. She continues toward the clinic entrance, contemplates the situation, and pushes open the clinic door. The receptionist sits behind bulletproof glass. Juno flashes jazz hands, and the receptionist raises an eyebrow and arranges documents on a clipboard, handing it with a pen and holding up a bundle of purple condoms from a clinic jar. The semi-crowded waiting room is filled mostly by expectant women, teenagers, and misbehaved children. The receptionist points to the document, motions for Juno to look, and Juno peruses an advertisement silently. The advertisement contains a photo of an appealing pair with vague smiles. We see Paulie’s bedroom window with childish drapes and the light on inside. Bleeker lies on his car-bed in his track attire, listening to the same LP from when he and Juno were intimate, and gazes at Juno's yearbook photo, which has a messy handwritten note from her. Bren and Mac are predictably speechless when Leah presents the Penny Saver photographs of the Lornings. Bren looks alarmed as Juno hurriedly attempts to justify the situation. Music plays, and we see sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s hands preparing her residence for Juno's arrival, tidying a vase of blossoms.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: As the classroom is bustled into by students, order is tried to be maintained by the teacher, Mr. Tinker. Her desk is headed toward by Juno, her bag set down, and her eyes are met with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. Her girl lab partner dramatically stalks off. A large ad in the newspaper depicting a distraught teen girl clutching her head is examined by Juno. The phone is smacked a couple of times by her. A health teacher puts a condom on a banana in slow motion. Paulie's face is seen at the moment of his deflowering; he's comically wide-eyed with shock. Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell eat dinner at a typical kitchen table. Food is shoveled by Mac while he chats about his day. In a corner of Juno's room, a pile of neglected cacti festers. Liberty Bell's food is cut up diligently by Bren, with the silverware held by her brilliant nails. A needlepoint pillow of a dog is stitched by Bren. Bren's nail salon gloriously sees her chatting up a customer and applying a fresh coat while she speaks in her strong city accent. Her dinner is blithely poured with bacon bits by Liberty Bell. The front entrance of the clinic is trudged toward by Juno, and she recognizes the protester as a classmate. The clinic entrance is continued toward by her, the situation is considered, and the clinic door is pushed open. Behind bulletproof glass, the receptionist sits. Jazz hands are flashed by Juno, and an eyebrow is raised by the receptionist; paperwork is arranged on a clipboard, handed with a pen, and a fistful of purple condoms is held up from a clinic jar. The semi-crowded waiting room mostly occupies pregnant women, teens, and ill-behaved children. The paper is pointed to by the receptionist, and Juno is motioned to look and scans an ad silently. A photo of an attractive couple with ambiguous smiles is contained in the ad. Paulie’s bedroom window with childish curtains and the light on inside is seen. On his car-bed in his track uniform, Bleeker listens to the same LP from when he and Juno were intimate and stares at Juno's yearbook photo, which displays a sloppy handwritten message from her. When Leah presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings, Bren and Mac are predictably speechless. As Juno hastily attempts to legitimize the situation, Bren looks alarmed. Music plays, and sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s hands preparing her house for Juno's arrival, sprucing a vase of flowers, are seen.

Juno heads to her desk, sets down her bag, and exchanges glances with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker, as her female partner stalks off dramatically. Juno examines a newspaper ad showing a distraught teen girl clutching her head, then smacks the phone. A health teacher in slow motion demonstrates using a condom on a banana. Neglected cacti accumulate in Juno's room. Bren cuts Liberty Bell's food, her brilliant nails holding the silverware. Bren stitches a needlepoint pillow of a dog and chats with a customer in her nail salon, speaking in her strong city accent. Liberty Bell pours bacon bits on her dinner. Juno sees an ad of an attractive couple with ambiguous smiles. Bren and Mac are speechless when Leah presents Penny Saver photos of the Lornings. Bren looks alarmed as Juno tries to legitimize the situation. Music plays while Vanessa Loring prepares her house for Juno's arrival, sprucing a vase of flowers.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Students enter the classroom as Mr. Tinker attempts to maintain order. Juno heads to her desk, meets eyes with lab partner Bleeker, while her girl partner leaves dramatically. Juno sees an ad of a distressed teen girl. A health teacher slowly puts a condom on a banana. Paulie is wide-eyed during deflowering. Juno, Mac, Bren, and Liberty Bell eat at the kitchen table. Mac chats while eating, neglected cacti decay in Juno's room. Bren cuts Liberty Bell's food, stitches a pillow, and chats at her nail salon. Liberty Bell adds bacon bits to dinner. Juno recognizes a protester classmate at a clinic, enters, and greets the receptionist, who hands her paperwork and purple condoms. Music plays as Vanessa Loring prepares her house for Juno.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As a new day begins, the students energetically bustle and swarm into the classroom, creating a lively atmosphere as the teacher, Mr. Tinker, earnestly strives to maintain some semblance of order amid the chaos. Juno, with purpose, makes her way toward her designated desk, carefully sets down her bag, and then looks up, making eye contact with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. Meanwhile, her female lab partner departs with exaggerated dramatics. Juno turns her attention to a large, eye-catching advertisement in the newspaper, illustrating a distraught teenage girl clutching her head in distress. Frustrated, she smacks the phone a few times. Meanwhile, in a humorous slow-motion scene, a health teacher is seen methodically demonstrating how to put a condom on a banana. A flashback reveals Paulie's face at the crucial moment of his deflowering; his expression is comically wide-eyed with overwhelming shock.

At dinner, Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell gather together at the typical family kitchen table to share their evening meal. Mac eagerly shovels food into his mouth while animatedly chatting about the events of his day. In a neglected corner of Juno's room, a pile of forgotten cacti languishes and festers, unnoticed. Bren, with her brilliantly manicured nails, meticulously cuts up Liberty Bell's food, her fingers expertly holding the silverware. She is also seen crafting a needlepoint pillow featuring a dog. When at her nail salon, Bren demonstrates her skill and passion as she talks enthusiastically to a customer, applying a fresh coat of polish while speaking in her strong, distinctive city accent. Liberty Bell, seemingly oblivious, liberally sprinkles bacon bits onto her dinner with delight. 

Later, Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic and recognizes the protester as one of her classmates. Contemplating the situation for a moment, she continues her approach and decisively pushes open the clinic door. The receptionist, secure behind bulletproof glass, surveys the scene with a practiced eye. Juno flashes a spirited set of jazz hands, prompting the receptionist to raise an eyebrow in mild amusement while arranging paperwork on a clipboard, which she hands over along with a pen, simultaneously holding up a fistful of purple condoms retrieved from a clinic jar. The waiting room, semi-crowded, is mostly filled with pregnant women, teenagers, and unruly children. The receptionist points to the paperwork, motioning for Juno to focus her attention, and Juno silently scans an advertisement featuring a couple with ambiguous smiles, seemingly attractive.

Simultaneously, a view of Paulie’s bedroom window reveals childish curtains with the light glowing inside. Bleeker lies on his car-shaped bed, dressed in his track uniform, while listening to the same LP that played during their intimate moment, and he stares at Juno's yearbook photo, which bears a sloppy, handwritten message from her. Bren and Mac are predictably rendered speechless when Leah excitedly presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings. Bren looks visibly alarmed as Juno hastily attempts to justify and legitimize the perplexing situation. Music begins to play, and we see a series of sparse images depicting Vanessa Loring’s hands as she diligently prepares her house for Juno's anticipated arrival, thoughtfully sprucing up a vase of flowers in anticipation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As a fresh day dawns, students eagerly and energetically bustle into the classroom, creating a vibrant and lively atmosphere. Amid this lively chaos, the teacher, Mr. Tinker, earnestly strives to maintain some semblance of order and discipline. With a sense of purpose, Juno makes her way toward her designated desk, carefully setting down her bag. She then looks up, making deliberate eye contact with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. Meanwhile, her female lab partner departs with exaggerated dramatics, adding an element of humor to the scene. Turning her attention to a large and eye-catching advertisement in the newspaper, Juno sees a distraught teenage girl, clutching her head in apparent distress. Feeling frustrated, she smacks the phone a few times. During this moment, in a humorous slow-motion scene, a health teacher is methodically showcasing how to put a condom on a banana. A flashback humorously reveals Paulie’s face at the critical moment of his deflowering; his expression is comically wide-eyed and full of overwhelming shock.

In the evening, gathered around the typical family kitchen table, Juno, her father Mac, stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell come together to share their evening meal. Mac eagerly shovels food into his mouth while animatedly chatting, regaling the family with stories about his day. In a neglected corner of Juno’s cluttered room, a pile of forgotten cacti languishes and festers, left unnoticed. With her brilliantly manicured nails, Bren meticulously cuts up Liberty Bell’s food, expertly holding the silverware with practiced fingers. At the same time, she is seen crafting a needlepoint pillow featuring a cute dog. When at her nail salon, Bren demonstrates her skill and passion, enthusiastically engaging with a customer while applying a fresh coat of polish and speaking in her strong, distinctive city accent. Liberty Bell, seemingly oblivious, delightedly sprinkles bacon bits liberally onto her dinner.

Later, Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic and recognizes the protester as one of her classmates. She pauses, contemplating the situation, then continues her approach with determination and decisively pushes open the clinic door. Secure behind bulletproof glass, the receptionist surveys the scene with a practiced eye, observing the interactions. Juno, with a burst of energy, flashes a spirited set of jazz hands, prompting a mildly amused eyebrow raise from the receptionist. The receptionist, arranging paperwork on a clipboard, hands it over to Juno along with a pen, simultaneously holding up a fistful of purple condoms retrieved from a clinic jar. The waiting room is semi-crowded, mostly filled with pregnant women, teenagers, and some unruly children. The receptionist gestures toward the paperwork, indicating for Juno to focus her attention, while Juno silently scans an advertisement featuring a couple with ambiguous yet seemingly attractive smiles.

Simultaneously, a view through Paulie's bedroom window reveals childish curtains with the light warmly glowing inside. Bleeker lies on his car-shaped bed, dressed in his track uniform, while listening to the same LP that played during their intimate moment. He stares at Juno's yearbook photo, which bears a sloppy, handwritten message from her. Bren and Mac are rendered speechless and visibly taken aback when Leah excitedly presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings. Bren looks visibly alarmed as Juno hastily attempts to justify and legitimize the perplexing situation to her concerned parents. As music begins to play, we are shown a series of sparse images depicting Vanessa Loring’s hands as she diligently prepares her house for Juno's anticipated arrival, thoughtfully sprucing up a lovely vase of flowers in anticipation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As students hurry into the classroom, creating a bustling environment, Mr. Tinker stands at the front and makes attempts to restore order with an authoritative presence. Amidst the commotion, Juno moves with purpose toward her designated desk, gently placing her bag down with a sense of routine. She lifts her gaze and her eyes meet the familiar and friendly eyes of her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. In response to this interaction, her girl lab partner makes a dramatic exit, adding an air of theatrical flair to the scene. Juno's attention shifts as she focuses on a large advertisement in the newspaper before her; it features an image of a distressed teenage girl clutching her head in a moment of despair. With a decisive motion, Juno smacks the phone a couple of times to ensure its functionality. A health teacher demonstrates in slow motion, the act of putting a condom on a banana, conveying an educational yet comical scene. At the moment of Paul's deflowering, his face is a sight to behold—his eyes wide with exaggerated shock, capturing a humorous moment. Later, Juno, along with her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell, sit around a typical kitchen table in the midst of their dinner. As they eat, Mac energetically shovels food onto his fork while engaging in a casual conversation about the events of his day. Off to the side, a pile of neglected cacti sits in a corner of Juno's room, appearing to fester from lack of care. Bren, with focused attention, cuts up Liberty Bell's food, her brilliantly manicured nails precisely holding the silverware. In a display of her crafting skills, Bren carefully stitches a needlepoint pillow featuring the image of a dog. At her nail salon, Bren is in her element, chatting animatedly with a customer while applying a fresh coat of polish, her strong city accent adding to the lively atmosphere. Meanwhile, Liberty Bell, in her carefree manner, casually pours bacon bits onto her meal. As Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic, she experiences a moment of recognition, realizing the protester outside is a classmate. With determination, she carries on, pushing open the clinic door and entering the space. Behind a barrier of bulletproof glass, the receptionist sits and observes Juno. In response to this encounter, Juno playfully flashes jazz hands, eliciting a raised eyebrow from the receptionist, who then organizes and hands over paperwork on a clipboard, along with a pen, and gestures towards a fistful of purple condoms collected from a clinic jar. The waiting room, semi-crowded and buzzing, is mostly filled with an array of pregnant women, teens, and boisterous, ill-behaved children. The receptionist points to a section of the paper, signaling Juno to take notice, prompting Juno to silently scan an advertisement. The ad contains an intriguing photo of an attractive couple with smiles that are left open to interpretation. The scene shifts, revealing the exterior of Paulie’s bedroom window, adorned with child-like curtains and the inviting glow of light seeping from within. Inside, Bleeker rests on his car-bed, clad in his track uniform, enveloped by the familiar sound of the same LP that played during his intimate moment with Juno. He gazes at Juno's yearbook photo, upon which a handwritten, albeit sloppy, message from her stands out. Later, Bren and Mac are left in a state of predictable speechlessness as Leah presents them with photographs of the Lornings from the Penny Saver. Bren's expression turns alarmed as Juno makes a hasty attempt to legitimize the unfolding situation. Music sets the tone, accompanying sparse visuals of Vanessa Loring's hands as she meticulously prepares her home for Juno's forthcoming arrival, including the careful sprucing of a vase of flowers to enhance the welcoming environment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Students bustle into the classroom while Mr. Tinker attempts to maintain order. Juno heads to her desk, sets down her bag, and exchanges glances with Bleeker, her longtime lab partner, as her other lab partner exits dramatically. Juno examines a newspaper ad of a distraught teen and taps her phone. A health teacher demonstrates using a condom on a banana in slow motion. Paulie is shown wide-eyed during his first intimate experience. At dinner, Juno, her father Mac, stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell engage in a typical family meal discussion. A neglected pile of cacti sits in Juno's room. Bren, with her polished nails, diligently cuts Liberty Bell’s food, stitches a needlepoint pillow, and later chats with a customer while applying nail polish at her salon. Liberty Bell casually adds bacon bits to her dinner. Juno approaches the clinic entrance, recognizes a protesting classmate, considers the situation, and then enters. Inside, the receptionist behind bulletproof glass hands her paperwork and offers purple condoms. The waiting room, populated mostly by pregnant women, teens, and unruly children, watches as Juno scans an ad featuring a smiling couple. Meanwhile, Paulie's room is shown with childish curtains as Bleeker lies on his car bed in his track uniform, listening to nostalgic music and looking at Juno's yearbook photo with a handwritten message. Bren and Mac are speechless when Leah presents them with photos of the Lornings, and Bren looks alarmed as Juno tries to rationalize. Music plays over scenes of Vanessa Loring preparing her house for Juno's arrival, adjusting a vase of flowers.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Students bustle into the classroom as the teacher, Mr. Tinker, renowned for his innovative teaching methods in science, tries to maintain order. Juno heads toward her desk, sets down her bag, looks up, and meets eyes with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker, whose track record in chemistry competitions is impressive. Her girl lab partner, a talented actress in the school's drama club, stalks off dramatically. Juno examines a large ad in the newspaper depicting a distraught teen girl clutching her head, which is part of an awareness campaign about adolescent mental health. She smacks the phone a couple of times, frustrated by its frequent glitches. A health teacher in slow motion puts a condom on a banana, a classic demonstration in sex education classes designed to teach safe practices. We see Paulie's face at the moment of his deflowering; he's comically wide-eyed with shock, reflecting the awkwardness of teenage experiences. Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell sit at a typical suburban kitchen table, eating dinner, illuminated by the soft glow of a vintage chandelier. Mac shovels food while chatting about his day managing a local hardware store, where business has been steady. A pile of neglected cacti, which Juno had ambitiously hoped to nurture, festers in a corner of Juno's room. Bren is cutting up Liberty Bell's food diligently, with her brilliantly manicured nails, a testament to her skill as a nail technician, holding the silverware. Bren stitches a needlepoint pillow of a dog, a hobby she picked up from her mother. Bren's nail salon is in full glory as she chats up a customer, known for being a local radio host, and applies a fresh coat while speaking in her strong city accent, a remnant of her upbringing in Brooklyn. Liberty Bell blithely pours bacon bits onto her dinner, a snack she discovered from a cooking show. Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic, a local family planning center, and recognizes the protester as a classmate with firm views on social issues. She continues toward the clinic entrance, considers the situation, and pushes open the clinic door. The receptionist sits behind bulletproof glass, a security measure due to frequent protests. Juno flashes jazz hands, a gesture that once won her a school talent show, and the receptionist raises an eyebrow and arranges paperwork on a clipboard, handing it with a pen and holding up a fistful of purple condoms from a clinic jar known for promoting safe sex practices. The semi-crowded waiting room is occupied mostly by pregnant women, teens, and ill-behaved children, a common scene at the clinic. The receptionist points to the paper, motions for Juno to look, and Juno scans an ad silently. The ad contains a photo of an attractive couple with ambiguous smiles, promoting a community relationship workshop. We see Paulie’s bedroom window with childish curtains, adorned with cartoon characters from his favorite childhood show, and the light on inside. Bleeker lies on his car-bed in his track uniform, a dedication to his athletic passions, listening to the same LP from when he and Juno were intimate, and stares at Juno's yearbook photo, which has a sloppy handwritten message from her that reads "Never change, Juno." Bren and Mac are predictably speechless when Leah presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings, a family known for their eclectic holiday decorations. Bren looks alarmed as Juno hastily attempts to legitimize the situation, providing context from a shared community event. Music plays, setting a reflective tone, and we see sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s hands preparing her house, a symbol of her meticulous nature, for Juno's arrival, sprucing a vase of flowers that she carefully selected from the local florist.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Students bustle into the classroom as the teacher Mr Tinker tries to maintain order. Juno heads toward her desk sets down her bag looks up and meets eyes with her longtime lab partner Bleeker. Her girl lab partner stalks off dramatically. Juno examines a large ad in the newspaper depicting a distraught teen girl clutching her head. She smacks the phone a couple of times. A health teacher in slow motion puts a condom on a banana. We see Paulie's face at the moment of his deflowering. he is comically wideeyed with shock. Juno her father Mac her stepmother Bren and Liberty Bell sit at a typical kitchen table eating dinner. Mac shovels food while chatting about his day. A pile of neglected cacti festers in a corner of Juno's room. Bren is cutting up Liberty Bell's food diligently with her brilliant nails holding the silverware. Bren stitches a needlepoint pillow of a dog. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Bren's nail salon is in full glory as she chats up a customer and applies a fresh coat while speaking in her strong city accent. Liberty Bell blithely pours bacon bits onto her dinner. Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic and recognizes the protester as a classmate. She continues toward the clinic entrance considers the situation and pushes open the clinic door. The receptionist sits behind bulletproof glass. Juno flashes jazz hands and the receptionist raises an eyebrow and arranges paperwork on a clipboard handing it with a pen and holding up a fistful of purple condoms from a clinic jar. The semicrowded waiting room is occupied mostly by pregnant women teens and illbehaved children. The receptionist points to the paper motions for Juno to look and Juno scans an ad silently. The ad contains a photo of an attractive couple with ambiguous smiles. We see Paulie’s bedroom window with childish curtains and the light on inside. Bleeker lies on his carbed in his track uniform listening to the same LP from when he and Juno were intimate and stares at Juno's yearbook photo which has a sloppy handwritten message from her. Bren and Mac are predictably speechless when Leah presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings. Bren looks alarmed as Juno hastily attempts to legitimize the situation. Music plays and we see sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s hands preparing her house for Juno's arrival sprucing a vase of flowers.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Cats bustle into the classroom as the janitor, Mrs. Fink, tries to maintain order. A robot heads toward its desk, sets down its bag, looks up, and meets eyes with its longtime lab partner, a plant. Its dog lab partner stalks off dramatically. The robot examines a large ad in the newspaper depicting a distraught teen girl clutching her head. The robot smacks the phone a couple of times. A librarian in slow motion puts a condom on a banana. We see a hamster's face at the moment of its deflowering; it's comically wide-eyed with shock. The robot, its uncle Tom, its aunt Emma, and a goldfish sit at a typical kitchen table, eating dinner. Tom shovels food while chatting about his day. A pile of neglected cacti festers in a corner of the robot's room. Emma is cutting up the goldfish's food diligently, with her brilliant nails holding the silverware. Emma stitches a needlepoint pillow of a dog. Emma's nail salon is in full glory as she chats up a customer and applies a fresh coat while speaking in her strong city accent. The goldfish blithely pours bacon bits onto its dinner. The robot trudges toward the front entrance of the clinic and recognizes the protester as a classmate. It continues toward the clinic entrance, considers the situation, and pushes open the clinic door. The janitor sits behind bulletproof glass. The robot flashes jazz hands, and the janitor raises an eyebrow and arranges paperwork on a clipboard, handing it with a pen and holding up a fistful of purple condoms from a clinic jar. The semi-crowded waiting room is occupied mostly by pregnant women, teens, and ill-behaved children. The janitor points to the paper, motions for the robot to look, and the robot scans an ad silently. The ad contains a photo of an attractive couple with ambiguous smiles. We see a bird’s bedroom window with childish curtains and the light on inside. A plant lies on its car-bed in its track uniform, listening to the same LP from when it and the robot were intimate, and stares at the robot's yearbook photo, which has a sloppy handwritten message from it. Emma and Tom are predictably speechless when a squirrel presents the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings. Emma looks alarmed as the robot hastily attempts to legitimize the situation. Music plays, and we see sparse images of a raccoon’s hands preparing its house for the robot's arrival, sprucing a vase of flowers.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Students bustle into the library as the teacher, Mr. Tinker, tries to maintain order. Juno heads toward her chair, sets down her backpack, looks up, and meets eyes with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. Her girl lab partner stalks off dramatically. Juno examines a large poster in the magazine depicting a distraught teen girl clutching her head. She smacks the tablet a couple of times. A health teacher in slow motion puts a glove on a zucchini. We see Paulie's face at the moment of his first kiss; he's comically wide-eyed with shock. Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell sit at a typical dining room table, eating dinner. Mac shovels noodles while chatting about his day. A pile of neglected succulents festers in a corner of Juno's room. Bren is cutting up Liberty Bell's steak diligently, with her brilliant nails holding the chopsticks. Bren stitches a needlepoint pillow of a cat. Bren's beauty parlor is in full glory as she chats up a customer and applies a fresh coat while speaking in her strong city accent. Liberty Bell blithely pours croutons onto her dinner. Juno trudges toward the front entrance of the pharmacy and recognizes the protester as a classmate. She continues toward the pharmacy entrance, considers the situation, and pushes open the pharmacy door. The receptionist sits behind tinted glass. Juno flashes jazz hands, and the receptionist raises an eyebrow and arranges paperwork on a clipboard, handing it with a pencil and holding up a fistful of blue lollipops from a pharmacy jar. The semi-crowded waiting room is occupied mostly by elderly men, teens, and unruly toddlers. The receptionist points to the paper, motions for Juno to look, and Juno scans an ad silently. The ad contains a photo of an attractive couple with mysterious grins. We see Paulie’s living room window with cartoon curtains and the light on inside. Bleeker lies on his beanbag in his track uniform, listening to the same mixtape from when he and Juno were intimate, and stares at Juno's diary entry, which has a sloppy handwritten message from her. Bren and Mac are predictably speechless when Leah presents the community newsletter photos of the Lornings. Bren looks alarmed as Juno hastily attempts to legitimize the situation. Music plays, and we see sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s fingers preparing her apartment for Juno's arrival, sprucing a pot of herbs.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Students drift into the classroom as the teacher, Mr. Tinker, attempts to restore order. Juno ambles toward her desk, drops her bag, glances up, and locks eyes with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. Her girl lab partner marches off dramatically. Juno inspects a large ad in the newspaper depicting a distraught teen girl cradling her head. She taps the phone a couple of times. A health teacher in slow motion balances a condom on a banana. We see Paulie's face at the moment of his deflowering; he's comically wide-eyed with amazement. Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell sit at a typical kitchen table, sipping dinner. Mac tosses food while reminiscing about his day. A pile of neglected cacti wilts in a corner of Juno's room. Bren is slicing up Liberty Bell's food meticulously, with her brilliant nails gripping the silverware. Bren embroiders a needlepoint pillow of a dog. Bren's nail salon flourishes as she entertains a customer and brushes on a fresh coat while speaking in her strong city accent. Liberty Bell nonchalantly sprinkles bacon bits onto her dinner. Juno stumbles toward the front entrance of the clinic and identifies the protester as a classmate. She progresses toward the clinic entrance, evaluates the situation, and nudges open the clinic door. The receptionist sits behind bulletproof glass. Juno waves her hands, and the receptionist arches an eyebrow and organizes paperwork on a clipboard, presenting it with a pen and holding up a handful of purple condoms from a clinic jar. The semi-crowded waiting room is filled mostly by pregnant women, teens, and unruly children. The receptionist gestures to the paper, signals for Juno to observe, and Juno peruses an ad silently. The ad contains a photo of an attractive couple with ambiguous expressions. We see Paulie’s bedroom window with childish curtains and the light on inside. Bleeker reclines on his car-bed in his track uniform, listening to the same LP from when he and Juno were close, and gazes at Juno's yearbook photo, which has a muddled handwritten message from her. Bren and Mac are predictably stunned when Leah reveals the Penny Saver photos of the Lornings. Bren appears startled as Juno hurriedly attempts to rationalize the situation. Music floats, and we see sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s hands arranging her house for Juno's arrival, tidying a vase of flowers.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Kaleidoscopes bustle into the cave as the librarian, Dr. Whiskers, tries to maintain chaos. Aardvark heads toward its drum, sets down its toolbox, looks up, and meets eyes with its longtime cloud cashier, Sprocket. Its clock cloud cashier tiptoes off dramatically. Aardvark examines a tiny sculpture in the magazine depicting a jubilant elderly walrus clutching its wheel. It smacks the trumpet a couple of times. A history librarian in slow motion puts a mitten on a potato. We see Buttercup's tree at the moment of its blooming; it's comically wide-eyed with anticipation. Aardvark, its cousin Basil, its stepparent Oracle, and Blueberry Muffin sit at a typical sports car, eating pancakes. Basil copies notes while chatting about its night. A hill of neglected violins festers in a corner of Aardvark's bookshelf. Oracle is cutting up Blueberry Muffin's lettuce diligently, with its wispy wings holding the spoon. Oracle paints a watercolor canvas of a goose. Oracle's bookshop is in full sleepiness as it chats up a dolphin and applies a fresh coat while speaking in its bold desert accent. Blueberry Muffin blithely pours sardine bits onto its pancakes. Aardvark trudges toward the back entrance of the gym and recognizes the gardener as a cousin. It continues toward the gym entrance, considers the problem, and pushes open the gym door. The astronaut sits behind bulletproof foam. Aardvark flashes jazz fingers, and the astronaut raises an antenna and arranges jellybeans on a clipboard, handing it with a pencil and holding up a fistful of green apples from a gym bowl. The semi-crowded patio is occupied mostly by sleepy kangaroos, sloths, and well-behaved robots. The astronaut points to the jellybeans, motions for Aardvark to look, and Aardvark scans a sculpture silently. The sculpture contains an image of a peculiar spaceship with ambiguous patterns. We see Buttercup’s rooftop window with playful tapestries and the lamp on inside. Sprocket lies on its tree-trunk in its soccer uniform, listening to the same symphony from when it and Aardvark were playful, and stares at Aardvark's calendar sketch, which has a neat typed message from it. Oracle and Basil are predictably speechless when Olive presents the Treehouse Journal sculptures of the Glorings. Oracle looks delighted as Aardvark hastily attempts to amplify the puzzle. Music plays, and we see dense sketches of Veronica Gloring’s hair preparing its backpack for Aardvark's vacation, sprucing a basket of rocks.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Cats scamper into the greenhouse as the gardener, Mr. Whisker, attempts to restore peace. Nimbus glides toward her perch, places down her food bowl, glances up, and locks eyes with her longtime bird partner, Feathers. Her feathered partner flutters off dramatically. Nimbus inspects a large ad in the newspaper depicting a confused teen goat clutching its horn. She taps the remote a couple of times. A chef in slow motion spreads butter on a baguette. We see Carl's face at the moment of his revelation; he's comically wide-eyed with surprise. Nimbus, her uncle Max, her aunt Bonnie, and Midnight Star sit at a typical picnic table, sipping tea. Max slices bread while gossiping about his afternoon. A group of forgotten succulents wilts in a corner of Nimbus's greenhouse. Bonnie is slicing Midnight Star's fruit diligently, with her vibrant gloves holding the knife. Bonnie embroideries a tapestry of a cat. Bonnie's flower shop is in full bloom as she charms a customer and spritzes a fresh bouquet while speaking in her rich southern drawl. Midnight Star gleefully sprinkles croutons onto her salad. Nimbus meanders toward the back gate of the orchard and identifies the singer as a neighbor. She proceeds toward the orchard gate, weighs the situation, and nudges open the gate door. The security guard stands behind a glass barrier. Nimbus flutters jazz hands, and the security guard arches an eyebrow and organizes documents on a clipboard, passing it with a pen and holding up a bundle of blue ribbons from an office drawer. The semi-crowded lounge is occupied mostly by tired tourists, hikers, and unruly pets. The security guard indicates the form, gestures for Nimbus to glance, and Nimbus studies an ad intently. The ad features a photo of a charming couple with mysterious grins. We see Carl’s study window with colorful blinds and the light on inside. Feathers relaxes on his bird perch in his racing jersey, listening to the same melody from when he and Nimbus were close, and gazes at Nimbus's postcard, which has a messy handwritten note from her. Bonnie and Max are predictably silent when Hannah displays the community bulletin photos of the Campbells. Bonnie appears stunned as Nimbus quickly attempts to validate the scenario. Jazz plays, and we see quick images of Veronica Campbell’s hands arranging her space for Nimbus's arrival, tidying a bouquet of wildflowers.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Students drift into the auditorium as the teacher, Mr. Tinker, tries to maintain harmony. Juno drifts toward her chair, drops her coat, glances up, and locks eyes with her longtime lab partner, Bleeker. Her girl lab partner skips off joyfully. Juno inspects a large ad in the magazine showing a pensive teen girl tapping her chin. She flicks the calculator a couple of times. A health teacher in slow motion wraps a hat around an apple. We see Paulie's face at the moment of his unveiling; he's comically wide-eyed with surprise. Juno, her father Mac, her stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell sit at a typical picnic table, sipping lemonade. Mac serves food while gossiping about his day. A pile of neglected books gathers dust in a corner of Juno's room. Bren is slicing up Liberty Bell's dessert carefully, with her sparkling rings holding the cutlery. Bren embroiders a tablecloth with a cat. Bren's bakery is in full swing as she chats up a customer and sprinkles some flour while speaking in her strong city accent. Liberty Bell blithely sprinkles croutons onto her salad. Juno ambles toward the front gate of the library and recognizes the greeter as a classmate. She continues toward the library entrance, ponders the scene, and pushes open the library door. The librarian sits behind beaded curtains. Juno waves jazz fingers, and the librarian raises an eyebrow and straightens paperwork on a clipboard, handing it with a pencil and holding up a handful of green stickers from a library jar. The semi-crowded reading room is occupied mostly by bookworms, teens, and restless toddlers. The librarian points to the checklist, gestures for Juno to see, and Juno examines an ad quietly. The ad contains a photo of an elegant couple with mysterious expressions. We see Paulie’s bedroom window with floral drapes and the light glowing inside. Bleeker lounges on his couch-bed in his track outfit, humming to the same tune from when he and Juno were close, and gazes at Juno's diary entry, which has a messy handwritten note from her. Bren and Mac are predictably silent when Leah presents the Weekly Bargain photos of the Lornings. Bren looks surprised as Juno quickly tries to legitimize the situation. Music plays, and we see sparse images of Vanessa Loring’s hands arranging her house for Juno's arrival, polishing a vase of shells.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Dogs trot into the ice rink as the zookeeper, Mr. Bumble, attempts to create chaos. Luna bounces toward her hammock, tosses her hat, glances down, and sees her longtime fishing partner, Dipper. Her pig fishing partner shuffles off triumphantly. Luna scrutinizes a small ad in the cookbook depicting a cheerful elderly man patting his hat. She flicks the candle a few times. A gym instructor in slow motion places a rubber duck on a pineapple. We see Charlie's face at the moment of his coronation; he's hilariously cross-eyed with awe. Luna, her uncle Joe, her aunt Maggie, and Crystal Ball lounge at a miniature race car track, snacking on popcorn. Joe tosses popcorn while rambling about his morning. A heap of shiny marbles collects in a corner of Luna's tent. Maggie is slicing Crystal Ball's apple expertly, with her tattered gloves gripping the knife. Maggie embroiders a quilt depicting a fish. Maggie's cupcake stand is bustling as she entertains a passerby and drizzles glaze while narrating in her strong country dialect. Crystal Ball cheerfully sprinkles croutons onto her salad. Luna trudges toward the back gate of the fairground and identifies the clown as a neighbor. She ambles toward the fairground gate, contemplates the atmosphere, and nudges open the fairground gate. The manager sits behind wooden blinds. Luna waves spirit fingers, and the manager shakes his head and organizes forms on a clipboard, offering it with a crayon and holding up a bundle of blue pencils from a fairground jar. The half-empty train station is inhabited mostly by weary travelers, kids, and hyperactive dogs. The manager gestures to the clipboard, signals for Luna to check it, and Luna examines an ad quietly. The ad features an image of a bored family with quirky postures. We see Charlie’s treehouse window with fruity curtains and the lamp switched on inside. Dipper rests on his futon in his karate outfit, humming to the same CD from when he and Luna were at the carnival, and gawks at Luna's diary entry, which boasts a messy doodle from her. Maggie and Joe are predictably stunned when Stella displays the Gazette clippings of the Elders. Maggie looks perplexed as Luna hastily endeavors to rationalize the predicament. Tunes resonate, and we notice scattered visuals of Aurora Elder’s gloves arranging her gallery for Luna's visit, polishing a basket of pebbles.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Students enter the classroom as Mr. Tinker, the teacher, tries to maintain order. Juno goes to her desk, makes eye contact with her lab partner, Bleeker, while her other lab partner leaves dramatically. Juno notices a newspaper ad with a distressed teen girl. A health teacher demonstrates condom use on a banana. Paulie's shocked expression shows his first intimate experience. At home, Juno, her father Mac, stepmother Bren, and Liberty Bell have dinner. Bren diligently cuts Liberty Bell's food with well-manicured nails and works at her nail salon. Juno enters a clinic, recognizes a protesting classmate, and pushes the door open. Inside, a receptionist hands Juno a clipboard and condoms, while the waiting room is filled with pregnant women and teens. Juno sees an ad with a smiling couple. Paulie lies on his car-bed, listening to the same LP from his time with Juno, staring at her yearbook photo. Bren and Mac are shocked by Leah's Penny Saver photos. Music plays as Vanessa Loring prepares her home for Juno's arrival.

teacher Mr Tinker tries to maintain order Juno heads toward her desk sets down her bag looks up and meets eyes with her longtime lab partner Bleeker Her girl lab partner stalks off dramatically Juno examines a large ad in the newspaper depicting a distraught teen girl clutching her head She smacks the phone a couple of times A health teacher in slow motion puts a condom on a banana We see Paulie's face at the moment of his deflowering he is comically wideeyed with shock Juno her father Mac her stepmother Bren and Liberty Bell sit at a typical kitchen table eating dinner Mac shovels food while chatting about his day A pile of neglected cacti festers in a corner of Juno's room Bren is cutting up Liberty Bell's food diligently with her brilliant nails holding the silverware Bren stitches a needlepoint pillow of a dog Bren's nail salon is in full glory as she chats up a customer and applies a fresh coat while speaking in her strong city accent
